content.description: Climb the right side of the tall boulder on side pulls and edges
content.location: Boulder between Heaven on Top boulder and Ring of Life Boulder. Across diagonally from Angles in a Cage.

content.description: Start with a high left hand in the grove. Tricky beta.
content.location: On the backside of Dirtbag and right next to Surrounded by Fish

content.description: Super hard problem on cool looking rock. Looks easier than it is.
content.location: Just right of Reese Did it in His Sleep.

content.description: Start underneath the right side of the cave with left hand on small crimp and right hand in a bigger crimp. Make 3 right handed moves up a big sloper that gets better. Then top-out.
content.location: Wet Dream Boulder

content.description: Start up the crack and grab some suspect patina at the top. Don't even think about falling.
content.location: Right behind the campsite to the left around the big fallen tree

climbs.name: Voluntary Dry Dreams
climbs.fa: This has likely been done but until claimed, Carlos Tkacz

content.description: Start by climbing Involuntary Lunge to the big break. Then, rather continuing up on jugs, traverse right and down into the end of Tuck and Roll, transitioning into Wet Dreams and finishing this climb. v10 + v6ish transition + v4 = v11? Not sure, curious to see what others think. It is a little contrived, but has some fun moves and is quite the power endurance test.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter
content.location: Down at the bottom at the Happy Hunting Grounds, in the Dreams cave

content.description: Start on some good edges and use a higher foot to move up to a huge hold in a hueco.
content.location: On a short boulder to the right of Dirt Bag and also across from Heaven on Top. Huge sitting log for Heaven on Top is almost touching this boulder. Route is to the left of the live tree.

content.description: Climb the dirty offwidth on the left side of the "Happy Hunting Grounds" boulder. It's dirty but fun. Tread carefully though, as a fall could be very bad.
content.protection: Don't fall or bring all of the pads and friends that you know.
content.location: On the far left side of the Happy Hunting Grounds boulder. Very obvious crack.

content.description:
Same start as Dreamsbut it keeps going until the last move.

After sticking that "blind slot" on Dreams, do a burly sequence to get into the start Wet Dreams, then finish her!
content.location: Wet Dreams Boulder

content.description: Start on one of two sidepulls and a good pinch. Straight up the arête to a tricky mantle.
content.location: From the dissing euros boulder you can see the back side of this boulder. It's facing the downhill side on the left side of boulder.

content.description: A balancy arete, with excellent moves on great slopers. A little high, but with a couple pads and some spotters not bad at all.
content.location: From the entrance to Happy Hunting Grounds, go down between the first to boulders. You'll see a boulder right in front of you. The arete is on the far side.

content.description: Start at the chest high holds on the right side, trend left as you head to a fun final move.
content.location: Just down the trail from Fifteen Years on Ice.

content.description: Start in the middle of the face with edges and a pocket. More thin edges and smears get you to the top.
content.location: Across the corridor and east of Dissing Euros boulder.

content.description: Highball right of Cielo start in the slots and climb up to a sketchy top out.
content.protection: Stacked pads, but don't blow it at the top.
content.location: Right of Cielo, the tallest problem.

content.description: Thin pockets up a slab.
content.location: North and east of Dissing Euros boulder. One of the first problems encountered on the right as you approach on the main trail.

climbs.name: Reese Did It in His Sleep

content.description: Start left of pine tree on good holds and go up and eventually left to a crescent like hold up high. Watch the pine tree branch at your back
content.protection: landing is good, maybe a pad
content.location: Left of the pine tree on same boulder as Whiplash

content.description: Stand start on good holds, then launch up the thin seam using precise footwork, to a good jug at the top
content.location: The boulder at the campsite used to access the Happy Hunting Grounds area.

content.description:
Behold, the often overlooked press-mantle just left of Gyroscope.

Seriously, folks: this thing is a genre classic. Compared to its popular older brother (Gyroscope), this problem rarely gets done. That's probably because it feels flipping impossible when you first try it. Call it an acquired taste. First time at it? Not so much. Second time? Ugh. But as you work the body positioning, the power, and the friction, you become a believer. Super good. And very hard to master.

Begin with your left hand on something sloppy, and your right hand on the bullet hole crimp, or on a sloper. Find a high nubbin for your right foot. Press on!
content.location: Immediately left of Gyroscope. You can use the Gyroscope bullet-hole crimp to get started, but it is most certainly its own line

content.description: Sit start on jugs. Move right and up to slopers and final holds.
content.location: Far east side of Happy Hunting Grounds. Really it's between The Keep and HHG in the gully.

content.description:
Several variations for the start. Matching on the obvious jug/flake seems to be the most popular way currently.

Ocean's 11

describes starting with a left hand crimp, and the right hand on the big flake.

From the start, make a huge huck for the high bucket on 'Dissing Euros'.
content.location: On the Happy Hunting Grounds boulder. The leftmost problem.

content.description: Stand or sit start on good holds and make big moves up right.
content.location: On a short boulder to the right of Dirt Bag and also across from Heaven on Top. Huge sitting log for Heaven on Top is almost touching this boulder. Route is to the on the very left side of boulder across from Good Pull. Start to left of south tree.

content.description: Start with both hands on the sloping ramp, pull up to the deep finger pocket and top out.
content.location: As you come down the hill, when the trail opens up into the Happy Hunting Grounds area, this problem is on the left side boulder right in front of you.

content.description: Another semi-contrived line, but with really fun movement. Climb Frenchman's Worst Nightmare, eliminating the big bulge/flake out left that allows for the kneebar. The result is a super shouldery sequence into a desperate crux- fun! I am unsure of the grade, but I based it off of other climbs there. Felt harder that Involuntary Lunge but not as hard as Whiplash. Just my opinion!
content.location: Happy Hunting Grounds, on the Dissin' Euros boulder.

climbs.name: New Ways to get from A to B

content.description: Use a couple of small vertical holds to get your right hand up onto the sloping ramp.  From here, figure out a way to ascend the dihedral.  Very tricky and unique problem that's worth figuring out.
content.location: As you come down the hill, when the trail opens up into the Happy Hunting Grounds area, this problem is on the left side boulder right in front of you.

content.description: Start under a roof with your hands on 2 crimps in the seam. Move up to a sloper and a side pull and dead point to some knobs at the top.
content.location: Start with New Ways from A to B on your right side and pass it by while walking straight towards a big oversized boulder that's 50ft in front of you. As soon as get to the huge boulder, turn around 180degrees, (facing the way you walked from) and the small roof will be right in front of you.

content.description: Sit start and make moves through the face ending up on many hard deadpoints to small patina chips.
content.location: On the 911 boulder all the way to the right side

content.description: Sit start on a good crimp and a scoop and move straight up on good crimps
content.location: Close to the Hueco problem

content.description: Start on undercling patina under the roof, make big move straight around the bulge, match and continue out right with the use of heel hooks and end with a beach whale topout.
content.location: Down the hill from The Hueco Problem

content.description: Sit start and move up to some heel hooks and powerful lie back snatches before the huge jugs up high.
content.location: On the front side of The Ring of Life boulder. Straight across from New ways from A to B and Angles in a Cage.

content.description: Sit start on a crimp loaf, move up to a finger slot on the left face, make a huge move up to a sloper and then head left up at the top. Might be height dependent.
content.location: On the south side of the Surrounded by Fish boulder. Kinda diagonal from Angels in a Cage.

content.description:
The direct line to Dreams.

Start on the blocky-jug. Make 3 hard moves to the top-out jugs of Dreams.

Steep. Dynamic. Tricky. Fun. What more could you want?
content.location: Wet Dream Boulder

content.description: Start as The Hueco Problem but move out left.

Start matched on the rail. Get the slopes. Probably go left, and mantel. Skirt back right, across the apron and climb the high but easy arete.

Maybe possible to mantel straight over, and/or go straight up the slab!
content.location: From 911, head downhill. The first big boulder to the left, with the large overhanging face. From the large overhang, continue around the corner to a small overhang and slab.

climbs.name: Happy Hunting Grounds (a.k.a. Heaven on Top)

content.description: This classic ascends the obvious line of crimps up the tall face just right of the blunt arete.  The climbing gets eases a little as it gets scarier...
content.location: As you hike down the hill, this problem is on the tall boulder to your right once the trail opens up into a large, flat area.

content.description: A 3-move Pine Mountain classic, proving that less is often better. Originally done as a "Gill start" (one hand on the rock and jump in), has been done static as well. My vote is that the original jump in way is better.
content.location: Left hand in bullet-hole crimp/pocket, one foot on and jump to the sloper up and right.

content.description: Start matched on a crimp rail with your feet out right. Move through some decent crimps and a good left side-pull to a good crimp rail and finally to a bucket over the lip. Finish up the slab.
content.location: Around the right side of the same boulder that Finish Your Dinner is on. (Right of Dirt Bowl V2 if facing downhill)

content.description: Start on a side pull and a shallow hueco pocket and make a big move up right to a large edge.
content.location: Find the Dirt Bag boulder across from Heaven on Top and move to the right side of the boulder. In between Dirt bag and Wrestling with Bears.

content.description: Climb the left side of the tall rock on nice edges.
content.location: Boulder between Heaven on Top boulder and Ring of Life Boulder. Across diagonally from Angles in a Cage.

content.description: Sit start behind a tree on two crimps with your feet out right. Bump through some slopers on the lip with your left hand until you can reach right for a big right hand side-pull. Bump your left hand in, close enough to make a big span out right to a crimp rail, and top out. Stand starts on the slopey lip and the right hand side-pull, goes at around V1 (FA: Ubi Kim)
content.location: Look downhill from Happy Hunting Grounds V3. From this perspective, the climb is on the front of the boulder to the right of Dirt Bag V2.

content.description: Start on a big bread loaf edge and work up and left. Fun.
content.location: Behind campsite two. Across from Stone of Gethsemane.

content.description: Start on the blocky jug and traverse right then make a blind throw for the good slot. Then follow the path of least resistance.
content.location: Wet Dream Boulder

content.description: Start left of happy hunting grounds on thin sidepulls and edges. Throw hard for the upper holds.
content.location: Happy hunting grounds boulder. Start on the arete left of HHG and continue up and left.

content.description: Grab the jug over the lip, pull yourself up and mantle.
content.location: Just to the left of Dirt Bag on the small boulder across from Happy Hunting Grounds.

content.description: Start with your left hand in an incut crimp and right on an open side-pull, move up through a couple more side-pulls before slapping into a large jug.
content.location: The smaller boulder across from Dissing Euros and Happy Hunting grounds on the northern arete.

content.description:
A quality problem on a beautiful, lichen speckled feature.

Start from a sit. Complete a tough first move to an incredible, triangular knob. Move up the bulge towards good holds at the top.
content.location:
The Pit Viper boulder sits in the drainage between Enlightenment Ridge and Happy Hunting Grounds.

Diamondback is on the downhill side, opposite Pit Viper.

content.description: A beautiful slab seam. Classic friction at the top.
content.location: On the boulder behind the left side of the campsite. On the boulder with Hot Potato and Well Fired.

content.description: Layback clean flake or stay on the face with bomber patina. There's a huge bucket right at the end.
content.protection: Crash Pad or better yet, don't fall.
content.location: On the Dissing Euros boulder around the right corner.

content.description: Start on a juggy seam at chest height and use high feet to get to small crimps on slab up high. Lots of lichen on the start hold.
content.location: On a short boulder to the right of Dirt Bag and also across from Heaven on Top. Huge sitting log for Heaven on Top is almost touching this boulder. Route is on the west side of the boulder to the left of One Move Wonder.

content.description: Climb the right arete using good pinches and hand/foot opposition to keep yourself from barndooring off the problem.
content.location: As you come down the hill, when the trail opens up into the Happy Hunting Grounds area, this problem climbs the right arete of the boulder in front of you..

content.description: A sit-start to Slope a Dope. Make a series of thrutchy moves to sloping crimps and don't fall off the slopers at the top. The bottom right handhold has been glued. Seems pretty tough.
content.protection: None. You hardly need a pad.
content.location: I guess I'm assuming you have the guide. Find Slope a Dope and you've found the problem.
